markdownRemark.html:
Interview Season

Doctors have it rough. After graduating medical school, they enter a period of indentured servitude known as residency. It is not uncommon to hear of over 80 hour weeks, 12 hour shifts and DOMA’s. DOMA stands for “Day Off, My Ass” which describes the period of time between a night shift letting out at 7am and a day shift the next morning. Technically 24 hours, but most of it is spent asleep. Between all of this a resident very near and dear to my heart has begun interviewing for a fellowship. A fellowship is a brief extension to residency that allows a doctor to focus on a specific area within their type of medicine. One example is ultrasound. This is a rapidly developing subspecialty of emergency medicine because it provides a rapid, noninvasive view of a patient’s internal state. Throughout the country there are over 100 ultrasound fellowship programs, all vying for candidates on this website. I have visited this site over 100 times.

It’s not the most beautiful website, but it gets the job done. One can tell that the data are organized on the backend in some sort of structure, however when presented to the user, it is tough to compare programs side-by-side. hello babe
